data.title: Chappell Roan Announces The Rise and Fall of a Midwest Princess Anniversary Vinyl
data.meta_description: Amid a string of incredibly successful festival appearances, Chappell Roan is celebrating the ongoing success of her 2023 LP with an anniversary pressing. Chappell Roan Announces The Rise and Fall of a Midwest Princess Anniversary Vinyl Mary Siroky
data.text:
The post Chappell Roan Announces The Rise and Fall of a Midwest Princess Anniversary Vinyl appeared first on Consequence.

In the midst of a monumental year, Chappell Roan is celebrating the continued success of her smash album The Rise and Fall of a Midwest Princess with a series of limited-edition vinyl pressings.

Since releasing the LP in 2023, the Consequence CoSign alum has more than found her audience, even reportedly pulling in one of the biggest Lollapalooza crowds of all time. “What a year it has been!” reads the statement from Island Records. “In honor of the upcoming one-year anniversary of the album that brought us ‘Pink Pony Club’ costumes, the ‘HOT TO GO!’ dance, and so many other unforgettable moments,” Chappell Roan’s The Rise and Fall of a Midwest Princess is being repressed on limited-edition vinyl beginning September 20th.

Get Chappell Roan Tickets Here

A peach vinyl variant is now available for pre-order on Amazon. Target is offering a peaches and cream variant, while Urban Outfitters is selling a coke bottle glitter green variant. Chappell Roan’s website is also offering a variety of vinyl versions, including stand and deluxe LP sets.

The pop artist is continuing the summer festival circuit, slated to deliver more excellent outfits and theatrical performances at Lollapalooza Berlin and All Things Go in both Washington, DC and New York. After that, she’ll hit a few standalone headlining dates in Tennessee, Arkansas, and Iowa. Snag tickets here.

Grab the vinyl here. Then, see where Roan’s 2024 hit “Good Luck Babe!” landed on our list of the best songs of the year so far, and revisit Paolo Ragusa’s interview with Roan about the album that started it all here. Plus, hear what songs Roan would assign to late nights, beach days, and experiencing crushes in her edition of Mixtapes.

Chappell Roan Announces The Rise and Fall of a Midwest Princess Anniversary Vinyl

Mary Siroky
